citation.article-title: Nosocomiicoccus ampullae gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from the surface of bottles of saline solution used in wound cleansing.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nosocomiicoccus gen. nov. Morais, Chung and da Costa
Nosocomiicoccus (No′so.co′mi.i.coc′cus. L. n. nosocomium hospital; N.L. masc. n. coccus a coccus from Gr. n. kokkos a grain, berry; N.L. masc. n. Nosocomiicoccus a coccus isolated in a hospital).
Chemo-organotrophic, mesophilic, slightly halophilic and aerobic.
Optimum pH for growth is around neutral.
Cell-wall peptidoglycan contains l-lysine at position 3 and A3α-type cross-linkage peptide.
Predominant menaquinones are MK-7 and MK-8.
The major polar lipid is an unknown aminophospholipid.
Fatty acids are predominantly straight-chain saturated and unsaturated.
The genus belongs to the phylum Firmicutes.
The type species is Nosocomiicoccus ampullae.
